5.4
Payment terms
Unless separate payment terms are agreed to outside of this Agreement by both parties in writing, payment terms will be as follows:
(i)
50% of the Total Order Cost must be paid on placement of the customer’s order.
(ii)
The remaining 50% of the total order cost must be paid prior to the goods leaving the warehouse of the manufacturer. The
Manufacturer will notify the Customer when the goods are ready for shipment prior to the goods leaving the warehouse.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.4
Payment terms
Unless separate payment terms are agreed to outside of this Agreement by both parties in writing, payment terms will be as follows:
(i)
50% of the Total Order Cost must be paid on placement of the customer’s order.
(ii)
The remaining 50% of the total order cost must be paid within 30 days of the customer receiving the goods. The Manufacturer will notify the Customer when the goods are ready for shipment prior to the goods leaving the warehouse.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a conflict in payment terms. Initially, the remaining 50% is due before the goods leave the warehouse. Now, the remaining 50% is due 30 days AFTER the customer receives the goods. This creates uncertainty about when the final payment is actually due, causing potential disputes and uncertainty of enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
7.2
Rectification of Breach
Where the breach is rectifiable, the breaching party has 21 days from the date of notification of its breach to rectify. Following the expiry of
this period, the non-breaching party may execute any rights it may have both in law and under this agreement.
7.3
Rights to termination
Without prejudice to any right or remedy both parties may have against each other for breach or non-performance of this Agreement each
party shall have the right to summarily terminate this Agreement:
(a)
On the committing of a material breach of this agreement providing that where the breach is capable of rectification the breaching
party has been advised in writing of the breach and has not rectified it within twenty-one (21) days of receipt of such advice.
perturbation.changed_text:
7.2
Rectification of Breach

7.3
Rights to termination
Without prejudice to any right or remedy both parties may have against each other for breach or non-performance of this Agreement each
party shall have the right to summarily terminate this Agreement:
(a)
On the committing of a material breach of this agreement providing that where the breach is capable of rectification the breaching

perturbation.explanation: The conflict arises because Section 7.2 provides 21 days for rectification of a breach, but Section 7.3(a) now provides only 10 days for rectification of a material breach before termination rights are triggered. This creates ambiguity as to which timeframe applies, making it unclear when termination is permissible and creating uncertainty.

1.2
Term
This agreement is for a term of ten (10) years.
1.3
Renewal
This agreement will be automatically renewed at the end of every ten (10) year term, with each subsequent term of renewal being for a ten
(10) year term. A six (6) months notice must be given by either party of their intention to terminate relations due to any reason other than
breach of this agreement.

1.2
Term
This agreement is for a term of ten (10) years.
1.3
Renewal
This agreement will be automatically renewed at the end of every ten (10) year term, with each subsequent term of renewal being for a five
(5) year term. A six (6) months notice must be given by either party of their intention to terminate relations due to any reason other than

perturbation.explanation: The agreement initially states that it will be renewed for ten (10) year terms automatically. The altered text specifies that the renewal term will be five (5) years. This contradiction in the renewal term's length creates ambiguity, making it uncertain how long the agreement will be extended upon renewal and therefore uncertainty of enforcement.
